title: Strictly's Oti Mabuse caught 'going off on a rant' in BTS picture
text:
Strictly’s Oti Mabuse was caught ‘going off on a rant’ in BTS picture (Picture: Instagram, Getty)

Strictly Come Dancing star Oti Mabuse was caught going off on a rant during the show’s highly anticipated Halloween night.

Taking to Instagram, the 29-year-old shared a behind the scenes snap of the evening that showcased her ‘annoyed’ face.

But despite being caught in a heated moment, the professional dancer was able to laugh off the picture in her Story.

Posing next to Michelle Visage, who Oti called ‘gorgeous’, The Greatest Dancer captain wrote a lengthy caption explaining the image.

She told her 308,000 followers: ‘When you’re going OFF on a rant and your friend doesn’t warn you about the cameras lurking @michellevisage look at you posing.’

It’s unknown what her rant was all about, however, we can only imagine that tensions were running high after the number of injuries that happened last week – seeing Kevin Clifton step in at the last minute to perform Neil Jones’ routine.

She managed to laugh off her ‘annoyed face’ (Picture: @otimabuse/Instagram)

On top of this, Will Bayley was forced to quit the show on Wednesday after doing some damage to his leg.

The 31-year-old suffers from arthrogryposis, a rare condition that affects all four of his limbs, causing curved and/or stiff joints and muscle weakness.

In a teary appearance on Strictly’s sister show It Takes Two, the Paralympian insisted his injury was not because of his disability.

He said: ‘I just want people to know that it’s not because I have a disability, I don’t want people to be put off dancing, it can happen to anyone, it’s just unlucky.’

Will Bayley was recently forced to quit the show after injuring himself (Picture: PA)

With a lump in his throat, the table tennis champ added: ‘It’s gutting isn’t it? I didn’t want it to end like this, I wouldn’t mind properly ending it, even if we went out next week or the week before, but I didn’t want to end it like this.

‘To do the salsa and getting you up in those lifts, I never thought I could do half of the stuff – but I was scared of dancing and [Janette] believed in me.’

Advertisement

His Strictly family has since taken to social media where they threw their support behind Will.

One of the latest to post was Oti, who told the star: ‘@willbayleytt CHAMP!!! You’re going to be missed. You’re so inspirational and it’s been nothing but an honour to know you.

‘Wishing you the best for the future!!! @jmanrara you’re forever a queen #teampocketracket.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.
